name: J.K. Rowling
short_bio: Author of the Harry Potter series, known for her magical storytelling and imaginative worlds.

name: George R.R. Martin
short_bio: Renowned for his epic fantasy series 'A Song of Ice and Fire', the inspiration for Game of Thrones.

name: Agatha Christie
short_bio: The Queen of Mystery, famous for her detective novels and beloved characters like Hercule Poirot.
awards: Mystery Writers of America Grand Master

name: Stephen King
short_bio: Master of horror and suspense, with iconic works such as 'The Shining' and 'It'.

name: Jane Austen
short_bio: Pioneer of romantic fiction, known for timeless classics like 'Pride and Prejudice' and 'Sense and Sensibility'.
awards: Legacy as one of the greatest English novelists

name: Malcolm Gladwell
short_bio: Bestselling author and journalist, known for exploring the unexpected in society and psychology.

name: Chiman Ngozi Adichie
short_bio: Acclaimed Nigerian writer, celebrated for works like 'Half of a Yellow Sun' and 'Americanah'.

name: Mark Twain
short_bio: Humorist and social critic, author of American classics like 'The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn'.
awards: Legacy as the father of American literature

name: Isabel Allende
short_bio: Renowned Chilean-American writer, famous for her magical realist works such as 'The House of the Spirits'.
